content_parts.text: Although some in the third and fourth centuries doubted John's authorship, the early witnesses favor John and express no alternative.
—There is no firm evidence for fixing a date.
The epistle's similarities to the Gospel of John, 1 John and 3 John suggest a date of composition close to that of these other books (AD 90–95).
The love of our Incarnate God brings promised victory over the antichrist.
—The epistle is addressed to “the elect lady” (v.
), most likely a church under John's oversight.
